sentence: In the wake of the announcement, DeSantis put out a rather misleading tweet, claiming the Biden administration made the decision “without a shred of clinical data.” Trumpy lap-dog Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) retweeted it.
author: John Judis
title: Where Things Stand: FDA Halting Use Of Some Monoclonal Antibodies Treatments Bursts GOP’s Anti-Vax Bubble

sentence: https://t.co/hP55vngVbh — Cernovich (@Cernovich) January 25, 2022 “Unconscionable,” reacted Republican Rep. Jim Jordan (OH).
author: Amanda Prestigiacomo
title: ‘Kill People To Harm Republicans’: Social Media Clobbers Biden Admin After FDA Blocks Antibody Treatment

sentence: “Racism is an evil that our country has fought against for generations, and we must stand up for the rights of all Americans to receive equal protection under the law,” Reps. Jim Jordan of Ohio, Dan Bishop of North Carolina, Darrell Issa of California and 13 others wrote in a Friday letter to Attorney General Merrick Garland.
author: Steven Nelson
title: Republicans ask DOJ to probe ‘racial discrimination’ against whites in COVID treatment

author: Karol Markowicz
title: Why we must demand that leaders who got COVID wrong admit it and apologize
